ngiemboon: Pi kímte saŋ metsɔ̀ʼ, ńjÿó línɔ̀ɔn pásékà ńdɔg ńguʼte Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé gi. Ńtí nue aa saŋ gẅie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé gi, la gwɔ́ tsɔ̌ letsẅɛ́ʼ, ńgÿo pi fó ngwòŋ Egíbtò ńkẅɛ.
en: “Set aside the month of Abib  ,# 16:1–8 Ex 12 and observe the Passover to the Lord your God, because the Lord your God brought you out of Egypt by night in the month of Abib.  # 16:1 Ex 13:4; 23:15; 34:18

ngiemboon: Pi ge gʉa nùɔ menɔ̀ɔn pí: é menjʉ̀njÿò, é mvfó, ńgÿo mefòŋ, é kẅile tsɔ̌ mǒ, é lɔg nuŋe pwɔʼ pásékà. Pi ge nuŋe púʼu, á mvfò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé gi, á jʉʼ gie à la záb páʼ à ge tsẅé wó.
en: Sacrifice to the Lord your God a Passover animal from the herd or flock in the place where the Lord chooses to have his name dwell.

ngiemboon: Á ge gwɔ́ fʉ̀ʼʉ línɔ̀ɔn pásékà, pi le pfɛ́ shúm léjÿó sie mé něŋ mvòŋ mǒ wɔ́; pi ge pfɛ́ mbelég té mvòŋ á na melyɛʼɛ́ láʼ sɔɔnmbʉ́a, e gwɔ́ mbelég ngɔ́ʼ, ńtí nue pi la lɔg pɔ́ sẅɛ̀te, éfó ngwòŋ Egíbtò ńkẅɛ. Púʼu la, pi ge láʼa néŋe fʉ̀ʼ ntsèm, á tsɛ̀ɛ gẅi legwɔ́, é kímte lyɛ̌ʼ gie pi la fó Egíbtò ńkẅɛ.
en: Do not eat leavened bread with it.   For seven days you are to eat unleavened bread with it, the bread of hardship #— #because you left the land of Egypt in a hurry  # 16:3 Ex 12:11  #— #so that you may remember for the rest of your life the day you left the land of Egypt.

ngiemboon: Mé té gẅiin légʉa na mɛ̌ melyɛ̌ʼ sɔɔnmbʉ́a ŋwɛ́, ńgyá lagá mvòŋ, á ndá gù mbɔɔ tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ gẅí wɔ́; ńgʉa na mbab gie mé ge lɔg nuŋe pwɔʼ ncwònzém á na mvɔ̀gmvfò lyɛʼɛ́ láʼ, mbà pi te leʼe tsɔ̌, tà njÿó e lʉ́a wɔ́.
en: No yeast is to be found anywhere in your territory for seven days,   and none of the meat you sacrifice in the evening of the first day is to remain until morning.  # 16:4 Ex 12:10; Lv 7:17; 8:32

ngiemboon: Pi te gÿo nuŋe pwɔʼ línɔ̀ɔn pásékà á tsɛ̀ɛ metÿǒsoŋ ntsèm mie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé gi, nǎ né pi wɔ́;
en: You are not to sacrifice the Passover animal in any of the towns the Lord your God is giving you.

ngiemboon: pi ge gÿo nuŋe pɔ́ jʉʼ gie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé gi, à la záb páʼ à ge tsẅé wó, é cʉ́ʼʉ lénuŋe, é nuŋe pɔ́ ncwònzém, á fʉ̀ʼ gie nèm pyě; púʼu, à lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ kwàʼ fʉ̀ʼ gie pi la fó ngwòŋ Egíbtò ńkẅɛ.
en: Sacrifice the Passover animal only at the place where the Lord your God chooses to have his name dwell. Do this in the evening as the sun sets at the same time of day you departed from Egypt.

ngiemboon: Pi ge tyé jʉʼ gie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé gi, la záb, é lɔ́ɔn, é pfɛ́, njÿó e lʉ́a tá pi piŋ ne tsɛ̀ɛ mentàb mí.
en: You are to cook and eat it in the place the Lord your God chooses, and you are to return to your tents in the morning.

ngiemboon: Pi ge pfɛ́ mbelég té mvòŋ, á na melyɛʼɛ́ láʼ ntɔgɔ́; à piŋ ńgwɔ́ na lyɛʼɛ́ láʼ mbɔ́ɔntè sɔɔnmbʉ́a, á gwɔ́ lyɛʼɛ́ línɔ̀ɔn yelÿò ńtí Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé gi, pi te faʼa fàʼ lyɛʼó wɔ́.
en: Eat unleavened bread for six days. On the seventh day there is to be a solemn assembly to the Lord your God; do not do any work.

ngiemboon: Pi ge zye lésáŋ mengàba láʼ sɔɔnmbʉ́a, á fʉ̀ʼ gie mé zyeté lélɔgɔ kunkwág, ńdag ngesáŋ ntsíŋ gie e nyě ńtyéte tyéte.
en: “You are to count seven weeks, counting the weeks from the time the sickle is first put to the standing grain.

ngiemboon: Afʉ̀ʼ kuʼ, pi gÿo línɔ̀ɔn mengàba láʼ ńdɔg ńguʼte Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé gi. Pi ge gÿo cʉ́ʼʉ léná pwɔʼ shúm sie pi kwoŋo kwoŋ ńnáa, é náa na ntí gie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a lɔ̌g ńnéŋ mbʉ́lè na pi púʼu.
en: You are to celebrate the Festival of Weeks   to the Lord your God with a freewill offering  # 16:10 Ex 35:29; Lv 7:16; 22:21,23; Nm 15:3; Ezr 1:4,6; 8:28; Ps 54:6 that you give in proportion to how the Lord your God has blessed you.

ngiemboon: Pi lâ penkʉ́ pí pembàŋa lâ pepanzwě, lâ ngàŋafàʼ gí yembàŋa lâ yepanzwě ńgÿo pʉ̀a Lěvî pie ée tsɛ̀ɛ metÿǒsoŋ mí, tà mbɔɔ pakÿoláʼ lâ púɔ métsé, ńgÿo mepfɔ̌g pie ée tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, ge gÿo tyé mvfò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé gi, á jʉʼ gie à la záb páʼ à ge tsẅé wó, é pú kág.
en: Rejoice   before the Lord your God in the place where he chooses to have his name dwell #— #you, your son and daughter, your male and female slave, the Levite within your city gates, as well as the resident alien, the fatherless, and the widow among you.

ngiemboon: Pi kímte páʼ pi la zɔɔn ńgwɔ́ menkwɔɔn tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ Egíbtò; pi ge kúʼte mɔɔn membʉ̌, é piŋ giŋ páʼ é ne ńzɛ́te.
en: Remember that you were slaves in Egypt; carefully follow these statutes.

ngiemboon: Pi ge gÿo gwɔ́ tà pú lag shúm, á jʉʼʉ lesaŋá shúm sí, é piŋ pú kyéen mentɔ̌ɔn melùʼ mie ée jʉʼʉ lekyěen melùʼ mí, é leen ké jÿó línɔ̀ɔn mentàb na melyɛʼɛ́ láʼ sɔɔnmbʉ́a.
en: “You are to celebrate the Festival of Shelters   for seven days when you have gathered in everything from your threshing floor and winepress.  # 16:13–15 Lv 23:33–43

ngiemboon: Á ge gÿo gwɔ́ fʉ̀ʼʉ yɛ̌ línɔ̀ɔn ŋwɛ́, pi lâ penkʉ́ pí pembàŋa lâ pepanzwě, lâ ngàŋafàʼ gí yembàŋa lâ yepanzwě ńgÿo pʉ̀a Lěvî mbɔɔ pakÿoláʼ lâ púɔ métsé, ńgÿo mepfɔ̌g pie ée tsɛ̀ɛ metÿǒsoŋ mí, e pú ńkág.
en: Rejoice during your festival #— #you, your son and daughter, your male and female slave, as well as the Levite, the resident alien, the fatherless, and the widow within your city gates.

ngiemboon: Pi ge jÿó línɔ̀ɔn mentàb na melyɛʼɛ́ láʼ sɔɔnmbʉ́a, á jʉʼ gie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé gi, à la záb; é lɔg guʼte Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé gi; ńtí nue Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé gi, à ge néŋ mbʉ́lè na shúm sie pi ka jʉʼʉ nkáʼ, e zém ńgyɔ́ɔn, tà mbɔɔ na mefàʼ mie pi lɔ̌g mbwó mí faʼ. Pi piŋ ḿbú ńkág lé ntʉ́m gẅí ntsèm.
en: You are to hold a seven-day festival for the Lord your God in the place he chooses, because the Lord your God will bless you in all your produce and in all the work of your hands,   and you will have abundant joy.

ngiemboon: Á ge gee na ngùʼu láʼ, mbàŋa ntsèm tóo mvfò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé gi, ngʉ̀a ntá, á na jʉʼ gie à zǎb. Pɔ́ ge tóo na línɔ̀ɔn mbelég té mvòŋ, é tóo na línɔ̀ɔn mengàba láʼ, e piŋ tóo na línɔ̀ɔn mentàb. Mé te gÿo tóo mvfò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a mbwó mesẅɛ̀ɛ wɔ́.
en: “All your males are to appear three times a year   before the Lord your God in the place he chooses: at the Festival of Unleavened Bread, the Festival of Weeks, and the Festival of Shelters. No one is to appear before the Lord empty-handed.  # 16:16 Ex 3:21; 23:15; 34:20

ngiemboon: Wɛ̌ nyìŋ wɔ́ɔ ge gÿo náa yé mmó gie à kuʼú mǒ; ndʉŋndʉŋ páʼ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé gi ka néŋ mbʉ́lè na yé púʼu.
en: Everyone must appear with a gift suited to his means, according to the blessing the Lord your God has given you.

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ ge néŋ pasáʼntsaŋ lâ palíe nò na lepʉ̌, á tsɛ̀ɛ metÿǒsoŋ ntsèm mie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé gi, à ka nǎ né mengẅɛ̀te mí ntsèm. Pɔ́ ge cʉ́ʼʉ lézáʼ mentsaŋ pʉ̀a láʼ, é lɔgɔ nò nénʉ́ záʼ.
en: “Appoint judges and officials for your tribes in all your towns the Lord your God is giving you. They are to judge the people with righteous judgment.

ngiemboon: Pi te neŋte lepʉ̌ wɔ́; é ké le sẅɛ́ɛ tsɔ̌ nyìŋ ńná né wetsɔ̌ wɔ́. É ké le zẅíŋe kwɛ̀ɛpwó wɔ́; ńtí nue kwɛ̀ɛpwó á tém nzěm menÿɔ́g pazsénò; ḿbiŋ ńgÿo pashwóŋo nò nénʉ́ fʉa kwò yɔ́b.
en: Do not deny justice or show partiality to anyone. Do not accept a bribe, for it blinds the eyes of the wise and twists the words of the righteous.

ngiemboon: Pi kag tʉ̀, ńgwɔ́ pashwóŋo nò nénʉ́. Tá à cʉa púʼu pi gwɔ́ wó, ńzyɛ́ʼ ńkúu tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ gẅie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé gi à náa né pi.
en: Pursue justice and justice alone, so that you will live and possess the land the Lord your God is giving you.

ngiemboon: Pi pɔ́ɔn légÿo ńgʉa ngʉ̀ŋe jʉʼʉ lenuŋé pwɔʼ gie pi ge gÿo kwɛ́, à gwɔ́ ye Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé gi, ńtÿɔ́g ntóon kà tÿǒ wɔ́ɔ gie ngwɔ́ mé guʼte.
en: “Do not set up an Asherah of any kind of wood next to the altar you will build for the Lord your God,

ngiemboon: Tà pi ké ńgÿo ḿbʉʼʉ tsɔ̌ tóon, ńtÿɔ́g tÿɔ́g, ńguʼte. Ńtí nue Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé gi, à te kwoŋ.
en: and do not set up a sacred pillar; the Lord your God hates them.
